it covers a large base area.

1.q_string: The Leaning Tower of Pisa does not fall because:
If the Earth stops rotating, the value of g at the equator will:
If Earth suddenly contracts to 1.5% of its present size, without any change in its mass, then how would the value of acceleration due to gravity change?
Kepler's second law states that the straight line joining a planet to the sun sweeps out equal areas in equal time. This statement is equivalent to the statement that:
The angular velocity of a planet revolving in an elliptical orbit around the sun __________ when it comes near the sun.
A planet is revolving around the sun (S) as shown. Keeping in mind Kepler's laws, determine the position at which the orbital velocity of the planet will be minimum.

A solid sphere of uniform density and radius \(R\) applies a gravitational force of attraction equal to \(F _{1}\) on a particle placed at a distance \(2 R\) from the center of the sphere. A spherical cavity of radius \(\frac R2\) is now made in the sphere as shown in the figure.


The sphere with cavity now applies a gravitational force \(F _{2}\) on the same particle. The ratio of \(F _{2}: F _{1}\) is:

q_option: Gravitational force is dependent on the medium between the particles.
Gravitational force is a non-conservative force.
Gravitational force is a two-body interaction.
Gravitational force holds good over a short range of distances.
1.q_string: Which of the following statements is/are true?
What is the dimensional formula for '\(G\)'?
What is the magnitude of minimum work to be done to shift a satellite of Earth having mass \(m\) from a circular orbit of radius \(2 R\) to a higher orbit of radius \(3 R\) around Earth?
What is the weight of a body at a distance \(2r\) from the center of Earth if the gravitational potential energy of the body at a distance \(r\) from the center of Earth is \(U\)?
Suppose that Earth is a hollow sphere. What will be the intensity of the gravitational field in the empty space inside it?
What is the least velocity required to throw a body away from the surface of Earth so that it may not return?

Earth is assumed to be a sphere of radius \(R\). A platform is arranged at a height \(h\) from the surface of Earth. The escape velocity of a body from this platform is \(f v_{e},\) where \(v_{e}\) is its escape velocity from the surface of Earth. The value of \(f\) is:
Consider a solid sphere of mass \(M\) and radius \(R\). The energy released in forming this solid sphere is:
